Posts.Content: Hello all, I'm glad to find this forum. My father(Age 59), has recently been diagnosed with PC on 2/25, we are still trying to soak it all in. His health over the years was normal, but his PSA was always high, below I listed it out by date since 2006. The Dr. gave him a score of 4+3=7, Grade 3 after his prostate biopsy. From MRI and bone Scan, doesn't seem to have spread in the bone or chest. However the Dr. suggested CT, got that and noticed something unusual on/in the skull. The Dr. recommends skull biopsy and will notify us further on how to proceed. Initially, Dr. gave 3 options, surgery, outside radiation or seed radiation, any suggestions? (Sorry, I don't know all the terminology yet) How likely is it that PC can spread to the skull? If so, what treatment would it be? He has an appt. tomorrow with the radiation doctor/center to discuss options, but I think it will be really basic due to the uncertainty of the skull spread. Does anyone suggest getting a second opinion? If so, any recommendations in the ATL area? Date PSA Level 2/3/2006 8.11 8/30/2006 10 10/27/2006 9.7 5/7/2007 10.7 11/12/2007 11.5 1/5/2008 12.7 3/10/2008 16 8/11/2008 11.1 2/17/2009 15.3 9/1/2009 12.3 3/6/2010 12.5 3/26/2011 17.2 4/6/2011 15.1 6/4/2011 14.03 12/10/2011 16 3/21/2012 13.08 3/21/2012 15.1 6/27/2012 17.2 10/24/2012 17.37 5/13/2013 19.19 6/14/2013 17.18 10/9/2013 18.57 3/22/2014 11.13 6/24/2014 11.96 10/29/2014 19.71 6/18/2015 23.39 8/19/2015 24.03 12/5/2015 23.03
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed- My Father

Posts.Content: Thank you for the welcome. Update: Suggestion from the radiology team just came in, "skull lesion is not large enough to biopsy" but wants to conduct follow up imaging, we are still continuing with Radiation Oncology meeting tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed- My Father

Posts.Content: Hello All, An update: We are given 2 options, External Radiation or Surgery (Removal of Prostate). I think we will be going with surgery within the month. They will have to do more scans on the skull to ensure it isn't cancerous.

Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed- My Father

Posts.Content: Hello All, My dad had biopsy over the past 8 years (if I remember correctly, 4), but all results came back negative for PC or any other issues, I'm not sure if the location taken from was incorrect or a mis-read by the Dr. I will look into Emory for a second opinion and also update you all tomorrow after the meeting today with oncologist. PS: I updated the above post that I mistyped, apologizes. "The radiology team does not feel that the skull lesion is large enough to biopsy, and follow up imaging should be done"
